perturbation.original_text: For the purposes of this Agreement, the following terms shall have the following meanings. Capitalized terms used but not otherwise defined in this Article I or elsewhere in this Agreement shall have the meaning ascribed to such terms in the SDA.
perturbation.changed_text: For the purposes of this Agreement, unless explicitly stated otherwise in a subsequent section, the following terms shall have the following meanings. Capitalized terms used but not otherwise defined in this Article I or elsewhere in this Agreement shall have the meaning ascribed to such terms in the SDA.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity by suggesting that definitions provided in Article I may be overridden later in the document, creating potential inconsistencies. It is not clear when the definitions in the article should be considered, and when not.

perturbation.original_text: "Affiliate" shall mean, for the purpose of this Agreement and notwithstanding its meaning in the SDA, with respect to a Party, another member of the Party Group to which the Party belongs.
perturbation.changed_text: "Affiliate" shall mean, for the purpose of this Agreement and notwithstanding its meaning in the SDA, with respect to a Party, another member of the Party Group to which the Party belongs. However, for the purposes of Article IV concerning Trademarks, Affiliate shall mean any entity controlled by, controlling, or under common control with the referenced party, regardless of Party Group membership.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Affiliate' is changed in the article about Trademarks, creating uncertainty. The main definition is for a member of a Party Group, which is limiting, and in Article IV, it is defined to be any entity controlled by the party, which creates an internal contradiction as a third party might rely on either definition.
perturbation.location: Article I, Section 1.1 and Article IV

perturbation.original_text: The licenses granted in Section 3.1.1 are limited to, and a Licensee Party and the other members of the Licensee Group will have the right to Exploit, only the Licensed Intellectual Property Rights within the Licensee Group Field, except for the purposes of research and development at a stage encompassed within U.S. Department of Defense Technology Readiness Levels 1-6 or NASA Technology Readiness Levels 1-6; provided that (a) such research is not intended for use outside the Licensee Group Field, and (b) in the course of research conducted for a third party outside the Licensee Group Field, neither the Licensee Party nor any member of the Licensee Group (nor any of their respective officers, directors, employees, contractors, agents or sublicensees) shall disclose such Intellectual Property Rights to the third party.
perturbation.changed_text: The licenses granted in Section 3.1.1 are generally limited to the Licensed Intellectual Property Rights within the Licensee Group Field, except for the purposes of research and development; however, the Licensor Party may, at its discretion, permit exploitation outside the Licensee Group Field through a separate written agreement. Details of such agreements will be outlined in Schedule 3.1.2(a).
perturbation.explanation: The change introduces a contradiction by suggesting that the field restriction defined can be overridden by the Licensor Party, creating uncertainty about the scope of the license. The original clause has a clearly outlined exception but the modified version creates an 'unless otherwise agreed' clause, leading to an inconsistent definition of the permitted license group field of use.
